means: 打破(break的过去式和过去分词)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 布罗克 Brook的变体

sentence.Network_en: They broke free and made off in a stolen car.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们挣脱后开着一辆偷来的车逃之夭夭。

sentence.Network_en: I'm broke, Livy, and I owe a couple of million dollars.
sentence.Network_cn: 我破产了，莉薇，而且我欠了几百万美元的债。

sentence.Network_en: Two years later he is flat broke and on the dole.
sentence.Network_cn: 两年后，他一贫如洗，靠失业救济金生活。

英语口语8000... ... 我没带现金。 I'm out of cash. 身无分文。 I'm broke. 现在我有很多现金。 I have a lot of money on me now.

entry.def: Broke is the past tense of break .

entry.tran: 身无分文的；一文不名的
entry.def: If you are broke, you have no money.

example.ex: What do you mean, I've got enough money? I'm as broke as you are.
example.tran: 你是什么意思，我的钱还富余吗？我已和你一样分文不剩了。

entry.def: If a company or person goes broke, they lose money and are unable to continue in business or to pay their debts.

example.ex: Balton went broke twice in his career.
example.tran: 巴尔顿一生中经历了两次破产。

entry.def: If you go for broke, you take the most extreme or risky of the possible courses of action in order to try and achieve success.

example.ex: It was a sharp disagreement about whether to go for broke or whether to compromise.
example.tran: 是放手一搏还是保守妥协，在这一问题上的分歧很尖锐。

Sentence.sentence: I wonder if I broke something.
Imagine that someone in your neighborhood broke the law, and the judge put the whole neighborhood under suspicion
That same study found that randomly assigned interracial roommates at Ohio State broke up before the end of the quarter about twice as often as same-race roommates.
They broke up more often than same-race roommates

sentences.en: I’m tired of being broke all the time.
sentences.cn: 总是一个子儿也没有真让我厌烦。

sentences.en: I decided to go for broke and start my own business.
sentences.cn: 我决定孤注一掷创办自己的公司。

means.word_mean: 不破就不修(如果某物还可以用就不要改变)

sentences.en: Why do they have to keep suggesting ‘improvements’ when everything’s working perfectly? If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it.
sentences.cn: 一切都好端端的，为什么他们总是建议要“改进”？不破就不修嘛。
